workflow.name: Generate stale page reports for Confluence spaces with REST API v1 and v2
workflow.description:
## Report stale pages in Confluence

This workflow generates a **stale page report** for Confluence spaces, helping teams keep documentation accurate, relevant, and actively maintained.

### What it does
- Identifies Confluence pages **not updated within a defined cutoff period** (in days).
- Supports both:
  - **Confluence REST API v1 (CQL search)**, and
  - **Confluence REST API v2** (spaces + pages).
- Produces a clean, aggregated report including:
  - Page title  
  - Page status  
  - Last updated date  
  - Days overdue  
  - Direct page URL
- Ideal for **content audits**, **documentation hygiene**, and **ownership reviews**.

### How it works
- The workflow starts via a **Manual Trigger**.
- A **Set Variables** node defines:
  - Atlassian domain
  - Space keys to scan
  - Cutoff age (in days)
  - API version toggle (v1 or v2)
- Two execution paths are supported:
  - **API v1**: Uses CQL search to fetch outdated pages directly.
  - **API v2**: Fetches spaces ‚Üí pages ‚Üí filters pages by last modified date.
- All pages are normalized into a consistent format.
- Results are **aggregated into a single `stalePages` array** for easy reuse in downstream steps.

### Setup
- Configure the **Set Variables** node:
  - `atlassianDomain` ‚Üí your Confluence base URL  
  - `spaceKeys` ‚Üí comma-separated space keys (e.g. `DOCS, ENG`)  
  - `cutoffDateDays` ‚Üí age threshold (e.g. `90`)  
  - `apiV2` ‚Üí `true` (recommended) or `false` for legacy CQL
- Create an **HTTP Basic Auth credential**:
  - Atlassian email + API token
  - Assign it to all HTTP Request nodes
- Optional:
  - Extend the workflow with email notifications, Slack alerts, or CSV exports.

### Notes
- **API v2 is recommended** and future-proof; API v1 is included for legacy compatibility.
- Pagination limits are set to **50 items per request** ‚Äî increase if your spaces contain many pages.
- If no results are returned:
  - Verify space keys
  - Check cutoff logic
  - Confirm API permissions for the token
- Tested against **Confluence Cloud**.

nodes.name: Confluence - Get Outdated Spaces via CQL

parameters.content:
## Confluence API Reference
* [V1 CQL Search](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v1/api-group-search/#api-wiki-rest-api-search-get)
* [V2 Get Spaces](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v2/api-group-space/#api-spaces-get)
* [V2 Get Pages](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v2/api-group-page/#api-pages-get)

### Notes
- API v2 is preferred and future-proof; v1 exists for legacy compatibility.
- Pagination limits are set to 50 items per request ‚Äî increase if needed.
- If results are empty:
  - Verify space keys
  - Confirm cutoff days logic
  - Check API permissions for the token
- Tested against Confluence Cloud.
- Need help? ‚úâÔ∏è **office@sus-tech.at**

## How it works
This workflow identifies stale Confluence pages based on last modification date. A **Set Variables** node defines the core inputs: your Atlassian domain, target space keys, an age threshold in days and whether to use the v1 or v2 Confluence API.

- If **API v1** is selected, the workflow runs a CQL search that directly returns pages older than the cutoff date.
- If **API v2** is enabled (recommended), the workflow first fetches spaces, then pages within those spaces, and filters them by their last modified timestamp.  


Regardless of the path, each page is normalized into a consistent structure (title, space, URL, last updated, author). All results are combined into a single `stalePages` array, making the output easy to reuse for reporting, notifications, or exports.

## Setup steps
1. Open the **Set Variables** node and configure:
   - `atlassianDomain`: Your Confluence base URL  
   - `spaceKeys`: Comma-separated space keys (e.g. `DOCS,ENG`)  
   - `cutoffDateDays`: Age threshold in days (e.g. `90`)  
   - `apiV2`: `true` to use API v2, `false` for legacy CQL  
2. Create an **HTTP Basic Auth** credential in n8n using your Atlassian email and API token.
3. Assign this credential to all HTTP Request nodes in the workflow.
4. (Optional) Add follow-up nodes for email, Slack alerts, or CSV export using the `stalePages` output.

main.node: Confluence - Get Outdated Spaces via CQL

user.name: Alexander Schnabl
user.bio: I create solutions that streamline IT service management and enterprise operations - from automated ticket handling to end-to-end process orchestration with assets, data quality checks and AI integrations.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
